definition: to stick up/to rise on one end/to tilt
to stick up/to rise on one end/to tilt

sentences.english: Jack calls out to Ellis, but Ellis is dead.
sentences.chinese: 杰克通过电话大声喊叫着埃利斯，但他已经死翘翘了。

sentences.english: Because you take the wrong part, you get typecast, you're dead.
sentences.chinese: 因为你搞错了你的角色，死翘翘了。

sentences.english: He'll probably be selling those Iguana Bits of his till he keels over dead.
sentences.chinese: 如果他还没有死翘翘，他很可能在卖他的蜥蜴串。

sentences.english: For God sake, I'm gonna be as dead as a doornail in five days.
sentences.chinese: 算啦，我五天后就死翘翘了。

sentences.english: Rejoice I sit on the behind and otherwise and early died.
sentences.chinese: 庆幸我坐在后面，不然早就死翘翘了。

sentences.english: For those of you counting at home, Inception is the third movie in a row in which DiCaprio’s crazy wife suddenly dies.
sentences.chinese: 在电影《奠基》中，迪卡普里奥的疯老婆突然死翘翘。

definition: to die (idiom)/to breathe one's last/to give up the ghost
Stop it! (Beijing and Internet slang)/Game over!/You're dead!
see 一命嗚呼|一命呜呼[yi1 ming4 wu1 hu1]
half dead (of torment, hunger, tiredness etc)/(tired) to death/(terrified) out of one's wits/(beaten) to within an inch of one's life/(knock) the daylights out of sb
to die out/to be exterminated/to become extinct
to infuriate/to be furious/to die from an excess of anger
